Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which six eradicated diseases are making a comeback, as only one disease (smallpox) has been eradicated among humans.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that refugees and illegal immigrants are the sole reason for the comeback of these diseases, without providing enough evidence to support this assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough supporting evidence to prove that refugees and illegal immigrants are responsible for the resurgence of these diseases.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that only one disease (smallpox) has been eradicated among humans, while stating that six diseases have been eradicated.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the resurgence of these diseases, such as changes in vaccination rates or other factors.
